title: Citibank Launches New Wealth Management Service Center in Bahrain
summary: Manama – As part of its ongoing efforts to meet evolving client expectations in the Region, Citibank today opened a Service Center of EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) International Personal Banking (IPB) business in the Kingdom of Bahrain. IPB offers a bouquet of offshore international wealth management products and services targeting sophisticated investors who wish to tap into international investment opportunities, available through the bank's offices in London and Jersey, as part of a balanced portfolio.
tag-1: Citibank Launches New Wealth Management Service Center in Bahrain
tag-2: Manama – As part of its ongoing efforts to meet evolving client expectations in the Region, Citibank today opened a Service Center of EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) International Personal Banking (IPB) business in the Kingdom of Bahrain. IPB offers a bouquet of offshore international wealth management products and services targeting sophisticated investors who wish to tap into international investment opportunities, available through the bank's offices in London and Jersey, as part of a balanced portfolio.
tag-3: Citibank's International Personal Bank operates from 14 offices around the world and has more than 185,000 customers and nearly US$35.5 billion of client assets under management. Citi International Personal Bank EMEA provides local as well as expatriate clients with a personalized service to help them manage and grow their wealth through long-term wealth advisory planning, savings and investments.
tag-4: Through dedicated investment experts based in IPB EMEA Bahrain Service Center, target market clients will now receive a free financial health-check to help build tailored investment portfolios, and will have access to a diverse range of global investment products, multi-currency bank accounts, time deposits and 24/7 internet banking.
tag-5: These services compliment the bank's onshore Citigold offering, which focuses on providing clients with personalized and comprehensive financial planning solutions and wealth management products to help them preserve and potentially grow their wealth, as part of a comprehensive suite of banking services.
tag-6: "We chose Bahrain for this offering as part of our continuous investment in the country and due to the suitable regulatory environment that the government provides to the banking and financial sector. We are also keen on providing value added services to our clients in Bahrain and in select countries in the region," commented Mazin Manna, CEO of Citibank Bahrain. "Citi International Personal Bank EMEA services are an integral part of our investor offer which caters to the financial aspirations of local investors, while fulfilling the requirements of expatriate investors who seek one point of contact for their global investment needs. Our globalism, once again, is put to work for the full benefit of our client base", he added.
tag-7: Grant Carson, Business Manager of Citi International Personal Bank EMEA said: "Bahrain's potential and right mix of investor base fits IPB's unique offer of global investment opportunities and easy access to the international market. We will ensure we put our accumulated wealth of global knowledge at our clients' disposal, while crafting diverse portfolios that suit their discerning tastes and needs."
tag-8: Akash Samaiyar, IPB EMEA Regional Director, MENA added: "Bahrain is an important Service Centre for IPB EMEA offering discerning, affluent customers a wide variety of global Wealth Management products and services. The commitment to the Middle East Region is very strong – last year, IPB EMEA moved its Middle East and North Africa Regional Office from London to the Middle East. We believe in being close to the clients for strong value-addition and superior client experience. Highly trained, dedicated Relationship Managers based in Bahrain, working together with counterparts based in offshore centers in London and Jersey, will help create this experience for our clients."
tag-9: Citi has been in the Middle East for nearly 50 years and currently offers consumer-banking services in the UAE, Bahrain and Egypt. In the Kingdom of Bahrain, Citi opened one of the country's first Offshore Banking Units (OBUs) in 1970. Today, the bank is currently a major player in Bahrain's credit card market and a leading provider of Wealth Management and Consumer Credit services.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
